page.title: 19A SHOPPING STREET IN P'BORO.
page.content: Lincoln Road is a major road into and out of the city and is surrounded by residential areas. Its shops offer a wide range of services. Generally the shops are small and provide a daily and weekly shopping facility. Most of the shops were food shops or shops that provided small household goods. Small grocers, newsagents and wine stores were common on both sides of the street, while shops selling household goods included a D.I.Y. store, a furniture shop and a bicycle store. There are few restaurants along the road, mainly because most people who are going to eat out do so in the city centre. Two cafes and three fish and chip shops offered take away services. In between the small shops could be found small offices.
